messageBody:
On Sat, 1 Feb 2003, Steven Taschuk wrote:

> We don't even have to lose the namespace convenience: TestCase
> could implement the assertion interface and delegate to a separate
> object specified at, say, construction time.

Ooo! This idea I really like! So we could use the standard asserts where
we care to, but override asserts with specific signatures where and when
we wanted. Perhaps something like this?

Date expected, actual;
Asserter myDateAsserter;
...
assertEquals(expected, actual); // Invokes standard one.
setAsserter(Date.class, myDateAsserter);
assertEquals(expected, actual); // Invokes our dateAsserter.
resetAsserter(Date.class);
assertEquals(expected, actual); // Invokes standard one.

Using something like:

class Asserter {
void assertEquals(Object expected, object actual) {
assertEquals(null, expected, actual);
}
void assertEquals(String message, Object expected,
Object actual)
{
// do the usual stuff here
}
}

that we coudl inherit from. Maybe add some methods to make it easier
to override just the message printing behaviour, for example....

Would there be interest in adding such a thing to JUnit?
